name: Aaron Fields
tagline: Hello! My name is Aaron Fields and I build android apps in Austin, TX. Contact me at afields410@gmail.com or linkedin.com/in/fieldsaaronm.
body:
#Here's what I've been doing lately...

##

## [Bitcoin Price Index](http://aaronfields.github.io/BitcoinPriceTracker/)
Bitcoin Price Index uses the Blockchain API to allow the user to view the current price of Bitcoin in multiple currencies at a time. Published on the Google Play Store at https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=io.github.aaronfields.bitcoinpricetracker.


***

## [WeatherApp](http://aaronfields.github.io/WeatherApp/)
A simple weather app that prompts a user to input a zip code which is then used to query the API.


***


## [Prep | On-Demand Tutoring](http://aaronfields.github.io/Prep/)
This is my ongoing pet project. Prep helps university students find on-demand tutoring in real time on college campuses and helps fellow students make real money tutoring their peers on their own time.


***


## [PhotoMunch | Restaurant Search App](https://aaronfields.github.io/yelpProject/)
This was a team project where we created a restaurant search app using the Yelp and Twitter APIs.


***


## [WayBlazer + General Assembly Hackathon](http://aaronfields.github.io/wayblazer)
We won the hackathon with this project. Travlr is a hotel search app that combines WayBlazer and Google Places APIs to provide itinerary suggestions.


***

## [Bookstore E-commerce App](http://aaronfields.github.io/book-store)
I'm a big reader so for my first attempt at an ecommerce app I figured a bookstore was appropriate. I implemented AsyncTask, SQLite, Picasso, and Espresso tests in this project.
